channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14433] Set down the client executor core thread count from 256 in tests
item.description: HBASE-10449 upped our core count from 0 to 256 (max is 256). Looking in a recent test run core dump, I see up to 256 threads per client and all are idle. At a minimum it makes it hard reading test thread dumps. Trying to learn more about why we went a core of 256 over in HBASE-10449. Meantime will try setting down configs for test.
item.summary: Set down the client executor core thread count from 256 in tests

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Turn down thread and keepalive for test runs.
Were you looking to attach a patch with that comment?
Change for hbase-server and hbase-client tests only. Make it so core is 4 threads (max is still 256) and keepalive is 3 seconds instead of 60.

Smile Nick Dimiduk

Here is recent zombie log that has reams of idle hconnection threads in it.... https://builds.apache.org/view/H-L/view/HBase/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/15581/consoleText

The zombie is TestReplicasClient It seems to have a particular knack for spinning up hundreds of threads. Comes of its slow-me-down-cp. Running it w/ the patch, it seems much better behaved with as many client threads as needed in stead of with hundreds of idles. I don't think this thread-count the reason for going zombie... but makes it easier to debug if less going on.

There is also TestRestoreSnapshotFromClient that is spinning up loads of client threads.

Is this meta lookup threads or regular core threads or both that we want to tune down?

We have this for meta lookup: 


               conf.getInt("hbase.hconnection.meta.lookup.threads.max", 128),

               conf.getInt("hbase.hconnection.meta.lookup.threads.core", 10),

and this for the regular pool:


            this.batchPool = getThreadPool(conf.getInt("hbase.hconnection.threads.max", 256),

                conf.getInt("hbase.hconnection.threads.core", 256), "-shared-", null);

Agreed that 256 core seems a bit stretched.

http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12755822/14433.txt
against master branch at commit 63a2fb5143ab41d84b6b44001b63806534b26bdd.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12755822

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.0 2.4.1 2.5.0 2.5.1 2.5.2 2.6.0 2.7.0 2.7.1)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.TestProcessBasedCluster
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.procedure.TestWALProcedureStoreOnHDFS

at org.apache.oozie.test.XTestCase$MiniClusterShutdownMonitor.run(XTestCase.java:1071)

Enis Soztutar Core. Meta seemed reasonable.

The test failures seem like common zombies ... org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.procedure.TestWALProcedureStoreOnHDFS fails often (another issue already filed).

Retrying anyways.

This message is automatically generated.

Down the core client executor thread count from being equal to the max to instead be number of processors on client machine. Also down the keepalive from a minute to ten seconds.

Also set it so in test runs the keepalive is three seconds and the core thread count is 4 only in an effort at keeping down our resource usage/thread count when tests are running.
On second thoughts, leave keepalive at 60 seconds. Just change core thread count.
Try now jenkins is back.

Any chance of a +1

Retry

I got a +1 over on HBASE-10449 from the man himself, Nicolas Liochon

We need to test but for now will live with less threads till proved we need more.
Committing to master branch only. Let patch build run with less threads. Backport when we can show this change definitively better performance.

Ok. Reverting the patch I applied last night because discussion ongoing over in HBASE-10449. I'm instead going to just set limits for tests only.
Here is what I reapplied under the rubric of this issue. It just changes the config for tests. I applied to 1.2+.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Tests run with client executors that have core thread count of 4 and a keepalive of 3 seconds. They used to default to 256 core threads and 60 seconds for keepalive.
